data.title: Feature: Shared Transforms
data.body:
This pull request ports all members of `Transform` to be native shared objects, meaning that there is no `cast()`ing required to use.

Closes #93.

data.title: Create adapter shutdown
data.body: Only has an abstract shutdown...but it should probably have its own shutdown as well...

data.title: Improve transform's matrix use
data.body:
So that the user of our engine doesn't have to call updateMatrix every time they change a transform.
I think getting some kind of dirty variable in there again would be best, whether that is through the property system or custom setters just for transform to be better. 

Short term: just call updateMatrix on every object in endDraw.

data.title: Write Unit Tests
data.body:
- [x] Input
- [x] Transform

data.title: Modification of individual position members
data.body: Programmatically changing the individual x,y,z members of the transform object in GO appears to be broken. Current workaround: set position equal to a new vec3.

data.title: Init time print bug
data.body:
![wat](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/512416/2402737/1b655542-aa26-11e3-9199-4d2e904cbe86.PNG)

I assume this is because I use a custom font that is missing whatever character is trying to be drawn, but what the heck character needs to be there anyway?

data.title: Give warning for redefined yml objects
data.body: Right now if you have two objects with the same name in yml they both get loaded and one overwrites the other, just giving a warning is probably fine to fix this.

data.title: Add/Remove GameObjects from GameObjectCollection

milestone.title: Version 0.5.0
milestone.description:
## Break Week and Bug Fixes

This milestone falls on GDC week and spring break. We don't plan on adding any major features for this milestone.

data.body: There should probably be a way to add and remove objects from a goc programmatically.

data.title: Remove Required Meshes from Games Folder

milestone.title: Version 0.6.0
milestone.description:
## Alpha Release

The game will reach Alpha with this milestone.

data.body: Engine-necessary meshes like the unit-sphere or unit-square should be removed from the Meshes folder of the game, and instead embedded in the engine, most likely in a token string similar to the shaders.

data.title: Implement Struct Creation from Yaml

milestone.title: Version 0.5.0
milestone.description:
## Break Week and Bug Fixes

This milestone falls on GDC week and spring break. We don't plan on adding any major features for this milestone.

data.body: In Config there should be a function that's probably something like: `T getStruct(T)( Node node )`  that takes a struct and uses Colden's reflection magic to initialize all variables that match a yaml file and return the struct.

data.title: Warn When Script Not Found
data.body:
When loading an Object in yaml, if the script provided doesn't match a module, there is no warning and the object is just loaded as a GameObject instead of the derived class.

The user should be warned that the type they tried to use wasn't found

data.title: Feature: Graphics Cleanup
data.body: Just some cleanup, use sample game's graphics cleanup branch.

data.title: Feature: Inline Children
data.body:
This closes issue #83.

Relies on #84.

data.title: Feature: Sharing is Caring
data.body:
This pull request contains the initial migration to `shared`, which will allow future parallelization.

See Sample-Dash-Game/feature/concurrency for a demo.

Closes #74.

data.title: Implement Child Creation in Yaml

milestone.title: Version 0.4.0
milestone.description:
## GDC Milestone

We need to have a vertical slice of the game in a playable state.

data.body:
Highest priority would be anonymous child creation, where a new object could just be defined in the standard yaml format in a Children attribute.
Additionally, designating objects by name in Children attribute would be ideal

Example:

``` yml
Name: ExampleObject
Transform:
    Position: !Vector3 1 1 1
Children:
    -
        Name: ExampleChild
        Light: !Light-Ambient
            Color: !Vector3 1 1 1
    - OtherChild
```

data.title: Implement Shadow Mapping
data.body:
Status:
Directional lights can cast shadows with some minor glitches.
Point lights will need #187 before continuing work.

data.title: Implement Forward+ rendering for transparent objects
data.body: See https://www.dropbox.com/s/ktngr903z641reh/TiledLighting11.pdf for details on the algorithm.

data.title: Rework drawObject call

milestone.title: Version 0.4.0
milestone.description:
## GDC Milestone

We need to have a vertical slice of the game in a playable state.

data.body: DrawObject should only add objects to a priority queue based on distance/position and eventually transparency. When endDraw is called, objects should be drawn.  This is needed for shadow mapping and transparency. We could also look into instanced rendering with this setup.

data.title: Feature: Point Lighting & Specular
data.body: You must be on Sample game's dash-point-lights branch to test this.

data.title: Convert Shaders to View Space

milestone.title: Version 0.6.0
milestone.description:
## Alpha Release

The game will reach Alpha with this milestone.

data.body: Currently the geometry pass outputs values in world space, and the lighting passes expect world space values.  The industry standard is that the variables work best in View Space which optimize many of the functions we will be working with.

data.title: Version 0.3.0
data.body: [Issues Closed](https://github.com/Circular-Studios/Dash/issues?milestone=3&state=closed)

data.title: Can only update transform.position with a vec3
data.body:
for example
`this.transform.position = vec3( 1,0,0)`
will update properly, however
`this.transform.position.x = 1`
will fail

data.title: Feature: Component Decentralization
data.body: This moves all Component Creation code into the modules for that component to allow for users to create their own components.

data.title: Migrate to Shared

milestone.title: Version 0.4.0
milestone.description:
## GDC Milestone

We need to have a vertical slice of the game in a playable state.

data.body: This will allow us to multithread any part of the engine we deem necessary.

data.title: Cleanup: Component Interface
data.body:
Switched to having component be an interface, that way components can inherit from other things as well. I also simplified creating prefabs substantially.

Closes #72.

data.title: Make Component Interface
data.body: This will allow components to extend Component as well as other things as well.

data.title: Add Compile-Time Reflection Features
data.body: This can be used to get the DGame subclass, as well as a few other neat tricks.

data.title: Feature: Documentation Generation
data.body:
This gives us the ability to easily generate docs for those modules who have it. It also contains a first pass of the docs.

Relies on #69.

data.title: Feature: Rework Properties
data.body: Properties now require fields to be provided, and allow for a future of less `std.signals`. This (more importantly) allows for documentation to be generated properly.

data.title: Move glsl out of shaders.d
data.body:
Tyler and I were discussing the location of our shader code, and while the current system works fine for now the size, complexity and number of shaders will most likely increase as we continue to add features.

We were thinking of a system where shaders can be paired in a file, i.ie. geometryVS and geometryFS and all the shader files could be included in their own package.

Another concern is the ShaderUniform enum which will most likely become massive, but we were unable to think of a good solution right now.
